p: Inhalation of compound 1, a major constituent of Tilia (lime blossoms) essential oil used in folk medicine and aromatherapy for sedation, had already been reported to cause a decrease in spontaneous motor activity of mice [ 25]. Similar results were obtained by Miyoshi et al. wherein it was concluded that benzaldehyde (compound 1 in this study), as well as anisylacetone (compound 6 in this study) which is an analogue of benzylacetone, have potent sedative activity through the same route of administration [ 21]. These findings are reflected in the present study; thus, confirming the inhalational sedative activity of both compounds.
